TopicTitle: Is it possible to convert a sandbox game to a career mode game?

Articles.Content:
I have a long term game I call the "Massive Space Program" somewhat in the same tradition as Scott Manley's reusable space program with a slightly different slant on things (mass production -> cheaper spacecraft and lifters) + reusability. I'd like to convert it to career mode. It uses certain mods, some I've figured out, others I haven't tried yet to make work with the new version.

Wondering if it's possible. Since new features and capabilities are going to be added to career mode, I'd like this game to work with it.

Thank you.

The point of career mode is to challenge you by taking away most parts and make you unlock them by building bigger and bigger missions bringing in more and more science. If you just drop in several generations of ship building into an early career, you're sort of defeating the point.

Most major part mods have been incorporated into the stock tree. Your best bet is to install these mods ( there's also custom tech trees, but part placement might be off if u have mods ) and start a fresh save. Work your way through the new tree. Then once everythings unlocked career turns into sandbox. So its the opposite of what you want unfortunately.

Then once everythings unlocked career turns into sandbox.

Yes, because the point is to start with nothing and build your way up, not start with everything and see how quickly you can unlock the tech tree with 20+ flights in progress.

I suppose it's easier for me to talk about starting from nothing, I lost over ~100hrs of ship building and saves, and bases on 4 planets when I reformatted my computer. So starting from scratch in .22 was not really a decision for me . . . computer runs great though. Love it to death again.

Actually I finished unlocking everything in the tech tree two days ago. Did it in 8 missions. I could've cut it down to six since one of the missions was a minmus flyby that should've been a landing (time accelerated too far) and the other mission (DUNA mission) suffered from a badly designed lander. It was supposed to land on Duna and Ike. Finally went to Ike instead after several tries.

Duna mission: http://imgur.com/a/dAyC0

The point is -- I already did it all. I just want to incorporate a very big effort I've been doing since once you've unlocked everything, you're basically back to sandbox mode.

I don't understand exactly what you're trying to do...

I believe it is possible, try to do this:

- Make sure you have updated all your mod for .22

- Backup your persistant file (of course)

- open persistant.sfs

- change the (Sandbox) in the name with (CAREER)

- Change the mode = 0 with mode = 1

- Change AllowStockVessels to False

- change to match


EDITOR
		{
			CanSave = True
			CanLoad = True
			CanStartNew = True
			CanLaunch = True
			CanLeaveToSpaceCenter = True
			CanLeaveToMainMenu = False
			startUpMode = 0
			craftFileToLoad = 
		}

- look or add

SCENARIO
	{
		name = ResearchAndDevelopment
		scene = 5, 6, 7, 8, 9
		sci = [B]xxx[/B]
		Tech
		{
			id = start
			state = Available
			part = mk1pod
			part = liquidEngine
			part = solidBooster
			part = fuelTankSmall
			part = trussPiece1x
			part = longAntenna
			part = parachuteSingle
		}

	}

where xxx is the amount of science point you need to unlock all the nodes.

- delete the quicksave to make sure you don't accidently reload it

load the game, go in the R&D, unlock every nodes/parts

and make sure all the current flight are working.

I haven't tried it, but it should work.

I am in the middle of huge campaign for the purposes of let's play series, and thankfully I can transfer my sandbox game to continue it with about half tech-tree completed.

Unless you want your space program ships and bases to be all at places where you have them in the old game, you can try to just start a new career and copy all ships files to its folder. The game will only allow you to load ships for which you have all the technology unlocked. Once you unlock them, you can proceed to place them wherever they belong.
